tweets.text:
Today we virtually celebrate defences in Melbourne Park being completed to the level of Storm Desmond great achievements despite major challenges this year

This part of the Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme better protects 1200 homes & businesses with ¬£12 million investment https://t.co/JBMnRuV58J

Global Commission on Adaptation Commissioner @EmmaHowardBoyd outlines the @EnvAgency new flood strategy that prepares #UK coastal communities for #climatechange. 

It's just one example of a #ResilientRecovery. To learn more, join us for #AdaptationWeek: https://t.co/j91yOklfzi https://t.co/gtXXNru3ag

The new issue of #CurrentMagazine16 is now available!

In it you can read how we‚Äôre working with partners to create climate-resilient places üëâ https://t.co/l0QFGnuN7T 

#ClimateResilience #CurrentMagazine16

tweets.text: Thank you for looking after our ecosystem as well as our residents, @EnvAgencyYNE! #nationaltreeplantingweek #mytholmroyd https://t.co/XlZH9hzYMh

Over 500 trees & shrubs have been planted at Brearley Fields as part of #MytholmroydFAS. 

For every tree removed to construct the new flood defences - 2 new ones are planted nearby. #nationaltreeplantingweek #NFM 

Read our latest news bulletin   https://t.co/HgdBp7TncO https://t.co/R6FXEhoByk
@AndynBrown16 @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencySW Time to crack that curtesy Andy ;)

https://t.co/JRdW0t31wC

urls.title: Guest blog - How nature dies by Alistair Gammell - Mark Avery
urls.description: Alistair Gammell worked for RSPB for 40 years and was closely involved in the drafting of the Birds and Habitats Directives and for growing RSPB‚Äôs international work. He was RSPB‚Äôs first International Director and retired from RSPB in 2009. He then worked to successfully establish large scale fully protected marine reserves in the seas around the British Indian Ocean Territory and Pitcairn Island. He is a passionate nature conservationist and fly fisherman (alistairgammell@yahoo.co.uk) Oughton Head is a

tweets.text: If you‚Äôve not been already have a look at our virtual stand at the  @EnvAgency Carbon Expo 2020 to see how we‚Äôre changing the way we work. https://t.co/FkaHBxS3AX

Some news! After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don‚Äôt go far- from today I‚Äôm our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! Can‚Äôt wait :) https://t.co/FkeIBPvdth
